Dear Mr. Harris:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,

ALLEGATION:
On 7/05/22, youth who were AWOL called the facility at 2:25 AM, asking to be
picked up. Staff told youth that they would not be able to pick them up due to being
short staffed. Youth did not return until after 4:00 AM
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7, 2022. Youth A
reported he AWOLed on July 4, 2022, and staff gave the phone number to the
house so when the youth were ready to return, they could contact staff to pick them
up. Youth A reported they called in the middle of the night. Staff 2 reported staff
2

could not pick up the youth because they did not have enough staff on campus.
Youth A reported he walked back to the facility with Youth B and Youth C.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7, 2022. Youth B
reported on July 4, 2022, he was mad and AWOL’ed with Youth A, Youth C, and
Youth D. He reported staff followed the youth around campus and they gave the
youth the phone number to the house to call if they needed to be picked up. Youth B
reported Staff 1 made it clear if the youth were in an unsafe situation and wanted to
be picked to call and police may have to be involved to make sure everyone was
safe. Youth B reported Youth D was picked up by Staff 1 around 11pm on July 4,
2022, Youth B reported in the middle of the night he called Staff 2 to ask to get
picked up. He reported Staff 2 said staff could not come get him because she and
Staff 3 were the only staff on campus, and she could not leave. Youth B reported he
returned to campus with Youth A and Youth C because they walked back on their
own not because staff came to pick them up.
Youth C was attempted to be interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7,
2022, and July 13, 2022, but refused to talk with this consultant.
Youth D was attempted to be interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7,
2022, but was on an outing and again on July 13, 2022 but refused to talk with
this consultant.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7, 2022. Staff 1
reported he is a campus wide supervisor and has been working at the facility for
approximately five years. Staff 1 reported he was working on July 4, 2022, at one of
the homes due to limited staffing. He reported his role at the facility is help assist the
direct care staff and cover shifts at the homes when needed. He reported Youth A,
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D AWOLed from campus around 9pm on July 4, 2022.
Staff 1 reported staff attempted to redirect the youth and followed them around
campus before they fully disengaged from staff. He reported the youth were
provided the home’s phone number to call if they needed to be picked up. Staff 1
reported the youth asked for this number prior to leaving the facility and Staff 1
informed the youth police may be contacted if they choose to AWOL because only
two staff were working on third shift. Staff 1 reported Youth D called campus around
11pm and asked to be picked up. Staff 1 reported he picked up Youth D from down
the street. Staff 1 reported he spoke with Staff 2 and Staff 3 about what to do if the
youth were to call to ask to be picked up. Staff 1 gave the instructions to call Staff 1
or Director for support. Staff 1 reported Director was covering on call duties since
Staff 1 had to cover a shift on July 4, 2022. Staff 1 reported he received a phone call
from Staff 3 around 2:28am where it was discussed that if the youth were to call to
ask to be picked up then the staff should call Director as Staff 1 was going to bed.
Staff 1 reported he left the On-call supervisor phone in his car but reported Staff 2
and Staff 3 knew to call Staff 1’s personal phone number. Staff 1 reported he missed
a phone call from Staff 3 around 2:45am. Staff 1 assumed Director took care of the
situation. Staff 1 reported when he checked the On-call supervisor phone he missed
3

a phone call from Staff 2 at 2:42am. Staff 1 reported when a youth is AWOL and
calls to come back to the facility it is the responsibility of the facility to pick up the
youth. If there is not enough staff on campus, the on-call supervisor should be
notified to help make arrangements. Staff 1 reported in this situation the staff were
directed to call Director as Director reported to Staff 1, he would cover the On-call
supervisor duties.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 13, 2022. Staff 2
reported she worked 3rd shift beginning at 11pm on July 4, 2022. She reported Youth
D was already back at the facility and Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C remained
AWOL. Staff 2 reported she was assigned to work third shift in the home Youth C
resides. There were concerns about Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C calling to be
picked up from AWOL and not having enough staff to pick them up. Only Staff 2 and
Staff 3 were working third shift, and neither could leave campus as they were
supervising different homes. She reported the facility attempts to schedule three
staff members on third shift for extra support but due to the holiday, only two staff
worked. Staff 2 reported she remained in communication with Staff 3. Around 2:25
am, Youth A called the home that Staff 2 was working in requesting to be picked up.
Staff 2 reported she explained to Youth A that neither Staff 2 or Staff 3 could pick the
youth up at this time and asked if he was safe. Youth A explained to Staff 2 he was
down the street from the facility, but it was a far walk and would not tell Staff 2
exactly where he was. Staff 2 reported she texted Staff 3 so they could call the On-
call supervisor. Staff 2 reported the protocol for AWOL procedures is that staff need
to pick up the youth from their location if it is safe and if it is not safe then staff are to
call the police to meet the staff member at the location. Since there were not enough
staff to allow a staff to leave campus, Staff 2 reported she was to call the On-call
supervisor for support. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 attempted to call the On-call
supervisor and Director right away. Staff 2 attempted to call the On-call supervisor at
2:42 am and left a message. She then called Director at 2:55am for support and he
returned her call at 4:15am. On the phone call with Director, she informed him the
youth have not returned and she was unaware of their location. Staff 2 called the
police at 4:30am and asked the police to look down the road from the facility for the
youth. The police reported they could not transport the youth. Staff 2 On-call
supervisor reported she did not know who the On-call supervisor was that night but
had been trained to call the On-call supervisor phone number for situations like this
for support. Staff 2 reported the youth returned back to the facility around 7:20 am.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on July 13, 2022. Staff 3 reported on July 4,
2022, she worked third shift at the home where Youth A, Youth B and Youth D
reside. She arrived at work around 11pm and Youth D was being picked up by Staff
1 from being AWOL. She reported Youth A, Youth B and Youth C remained AWOL.
Staff 3 reported she talked with Staff 1 before he left for the night about the concerns
of not having staff to pick up Youth A, Youth B and Youth C if they call the home.
Staff 1 told Staff 3 he was the On Call Supervisor, and she should call Staff 1 or
Director if they need support. Staff 1 told Staff 3 that Director would be able to help
transport the youth back to the facility. Staff 3 reported Staff 2 notified her around 2
4

am that Youth A called asking to be picked up by staff. Staff 3 reported she called
Director and there was no answer. She then called the On-call supervisor phone line
but there was no answer. Staff 3 reported she tried to call Director again and
continued to leave messages. She reached Staff 1 by calling his personal cell
phone. Staff 1 gave the direction that Director should be there for support. Staff 3
reported she was in constant communication with Staff 2 as well about who she was
calling and reported Director called Staff 2 around 4 am. Staff 3 On-call supervisor
noted if a youth is AWOL and asks to be picked up it is the responsibility of the staff
to pick up the youth. Staff 3 reported she does not know if the youth asked to be
picked up or not. Staff 3 reported the youth returned from AWOL a little after 7am.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7, 2022, and via
telephone on July 15, 2022. Director reported he was not working on the night of
July 4, 2022 and was not on-call for the facility at that time. He reported Staff 2 and
Staff 3 were the third shift staff working at each assigned house. Director reported
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D all AWOLed together on July 4, 2022,
around 9pm. It was reported Youth D returned from AWOL a couple hours later, but
Youth A, Youth B and Youth C remained AWOL. Director reported he was informed
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C called the unit around 2:30am on July 5, 2022,
asking to be picked up by staff from their AWOL location. Director reported there
were only two third shift staff at that time that were assigned to separate homes on
the campus which meant they could not leave the facility. He reported he spoke with
Staff 1 prior to the youth calling to be picked up due to the concerns of Staff 2 and
Staff 3 being the only staff on campus and how to support the youth returning from
AWOL. Director reported he told Staff 1 that if there was help needed Staff 1 was to
contact the Director and he would come sit at the house to help with the return to
AWOL protocol. He believes there was miscommunication as Director expected
Staff 1 to remain the on-call supervisor and contact Director directly not take over as
on-call supervisor duties. Director reported he heard staff called the on-call
supervisor. Director reported the staff then called his phone a couple of hours later
because they could not get ahold of the on-call supervisor. Director reported he went
for a run and saw Youth A, Youth B and Youth C walking by his home. He walked
the youth back to campus around 7am. Director reported when a youth is AWOL and
calls to come back to the facility it is the responsibility of the facility to pick up the
youth. If there are not enough staff on campus the on-call supervisor should be
notified to help with arrangements.
Documents reviewed:
 Facilities AWOL Procedure with the most recent update of 10/2021- The
purpose of this document is to guide decision making for staff when a youth is
absent without legal permission (AWOLP). The documents notes when a youth is
located the following steps will be completed: Program supervisor (during
business hours) or on-call supervisor (after hours) will be notified and determined
if it is safe to send a staff member to the youth’s location. If it is determined the
location is safe, staff will pick up the youth. If it is determined the location is not
5

safe, staff will notify Grand Rapids Police Department of the youth’s location and
arrange to meet GRPD as soon as possible.
 Facility incident report dated 07/05/2022 at 4:20 am- This incident report was
completed by Staff 2. Youth A called the facility at 2:25am to request a ride back
to campus. Staff 2 informed Youth A that they were not available to pick them up
and Youth A reported they were just down the street, but it was a long way. As of
4:20am the youth had still not arrived back to campus. Staff 2 called Grand
Rapids Police Department and informed them of the call and location of the
youth.
 Facility incident reported dated 07/04/2022 at 8:45pm- The incident report
noted Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were deemed AWOL at 9pm on
07/04/2022. Staff tried to engage with the youth and followed the youth up to
Dean Lake. The Grand Rapids Police Department was notified, and a report was
filed. All legal guardians, foster care workers, and licensing department was
notified.
 Facility incident reported dated 07/04/2022 at 11:30pm- Incident report was
completed by Staff 3. Youth D called the home around 11:20pm and was asked
to be picked up. Staff 1 picked up the youth and returned back to the home
around 11:35pm.
 Facility incident reported dated 07/05/2022 at 7:20am- Incident report noted
Youth A, Youth B and Youth D all returned from AWOL at the facility on
07/05/2022 at 7:20am by foot.
 Human Resource file for Staff 1- There was one disciplinary action noted in
Staff 1’s file dated in 11/15/2021 for failure to report suspected abuse and
neglect. Staff 1 was given a verbal warning and was retrained on the policy.
Training records were viewed and noted Staff 1 was up to date on training
requirements.
 Human Resource file for Director Staff 2 and Staff 3- There were no
disciplinary or performance evaluations that reflected poorly pertaining to
Director, Staff 2, and Staff 3’s work with youth at the facility. Training records
were viewed and noted Director, Staff 2 and Staff 3 were up to date on training
requirements.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
6

ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as it pertains to following
the facility’s AWOL Procedure. Youth A called the facility asking
to be brought back to the facility from AWOL and there was no
staff available to transport Youth A, Youth B and Youth C back
to the facility.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
